thread.title: Brock Holt exits Red Sox game after pitch hits his knee | Clubhouse Insider | Boston Red Sox News
thread.title_full: Brock Holt exits Red Sox game after pitch hits his knee | Clubhouse Insider | Boston Red Sox News | Boston Herald

author: Jason Mastrodonato
title: Brock Holt exits Red Sox game after pitch hits his knee | Clubhouse Insider | Boston Red Sox News
text:
CLEVELAND -- Brock Holt will have an uncomfortable start to his offseason.
Already dealing with an array of injuries over the season’s final two months, Holt added another to the list on Saturday night when he was hit by a pitch in the left knee and had to exit the Red Sox’ game against the Indians in the seventh inning.
Holt got fooled by an 82-mph curveball from Corey Kluber and wasn’t able to get out of the way in time. He dropped to the ground in obvious pain and buried his head in the crevice of his bent elbow. After a few minutes on the ground, Holt limped slowly off the field and was replaced by Allen Craig.
Official word from the Red Sox was that Holt suffered a left knee bruise.
